title: Giving While Living, How ESG Investing Lost Its Way, Activists’ Busy 2018, Druckenmiller Speaks
itunes:title: Giving While Living, How ESG Investing Lost Its Way, Activists’ Busy 2018, Druckenmiller Speaks
description:
Thomas Tierney, Chairman and Co-founder of The Bridgespan Group, discusses challenges in ultra-wealthy charitable giving. Rachel Evans, Bloomberg News Cross Asset Reporter, talks about her story for Businessweek Magazine on how environmental, social, and governance funds that promise to align your money with your values are often more marketing than science. Bloomberg News Deals Reporter Scott Deveau explains that number of companies targeted by shareholder activists hit an all-time high in 2018. Erik Schatzker, Bloomberg News Editor-at-Large, breaks down his interview with billionaire investor Stanley Druckenmiller who says we’re in a bear market. And we Drive to the Close of Markets with JJ Kinahan, Chief Market Strategist at TD Ameritrade. 

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan
